remarks: Given two decompositions of a prime as a sum of two squares, show that they are equal.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 2-Feb-2020.)
statement:
2sqmod.1 $e |- ( ph -> P e. Prime ) $.
2sqmod.2 $e |- ( ph -> A e. NN0 ) $.
2sqmod.3 $e |- ( ph -> B e. NN0 ) $.
2sqmod.4 $e |- ( ph -> C e. NN0 ) $.
2sqmod.5 $e |- ( ph -> D e. NN0 ) $.
2sqmod.6 $e |- ( ph -> A <_ B ) $.
2sqmod.7 $e |- ( ph -> C <_ D ) $.
2sqmod.8 $e |- ( ph -> ( ( A ^ 2 ) + ( B ^ 2 ) ) = P ) $.
2sqmod.9 $e |- ( ph -> ( ( C ^ 2 ) + ( D ^ 2 ) ) = P ) $.
2sqmod $p |- ( ph -> ( A = C /\ B = D ) ) $.
